column5: alright.. looks like i will be camping with my friends in may.. so pike should be open by then.. probably looking at something in the algonquin area or muskoka? anyone know of any good camping places with some pike i can go for around there? will try to bring my boat as well.  thanks!
or any place with good fishing at that time too.. please..? probably looking at max 3.5 hr drive from toronto.
Do you want a park type setting or just a place in the bush to go camping. Also, how big is your boat?

i just went ahead and booked six mile ....  the boat is a small 12 footer, but i will be bringing the trailer along with it. for me, i'd rather have it more like a bush thing, but for my friends' sake, we're going with the shower and electrical.
there is next to zero pike in Algonquin Park.  If there are lakes with Pike they were introduced and the park is trying to rid the lakes of Pike.

I know a nice little lake up North that is loaded with pike and a 12' boat would be perfect on it but the only washrooms are a tree and the shower only works when it rains. If you do decide to do a more remote thing in the future let me know and I'll PM you directions etc.

I personally love the Massasauga, but it is winderness camping. There are tons of back bays to fish and an abundance of Pike. You can easily and safely get around in your 12 footer. I use to use the same size boat there all of the time.
